meanings.definition: Make a vehement protest or demand.
meanings.sent1: The students were clamouring for longer recess.
meanings.sent2: The fans were clamouring for their favorite singer to come on stage.
meanings.sent3: The puppies started clamouring for more treats, wagging their tails excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside seemed to be clamouring for attention with its loud roars.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock kept clamouring for the sleepyhead to wake up.

meanings.sent1: The children were clamouring for their parents to buy them ice cream.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were clamouring outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The parrot in the pet store was clamouring to mimic the sounds of the customers.
meanings.sent4: The wind was clamouring through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The old radio was clamouring with static, making it hard to hear the music.
